dataIdInfo.idAbs: This tool moves attributes from one line network to another line network by Segmented Polygon Approach (The segmented polygons are generated using Thiessen Polygons in the Divide Polygons by Segment Tool). Alternatively, tool can use BranchID's from both networks to better manage tributary junctions.

tool.name: TransferLineAttributesTool

param.name: InputFCFromLine
param.dialogReference: The line network whose attributes will be transferred from. This network is used to ‘resegment’ the “To” line network.

param.name: InputFCToLine
param.dialogReference: The line network that will receive the attributes from the “From” line network. This line network will retain its segmentation and attributes, but will also be resegmented based on the transfer of the “From” line network. This allows both the new and original attributes to exist on the line network.

param.name: fieldBranchID
param.dialogReference: Field that contains the Stream Branch ID. The default output from the Generate Stream Branch tool is BranchID.

param.name: OutputFCLineNetwork
param.dialogReference: Polyline Feature class (in FGDB) that will contain the output line network with transferred (and original) attributes.

param.name: scratchWorkspace
param.displayname: Save Temp Files to Scratch Workspace
param.dialogReference:
You may use:

1. Create a new file GDB to save temporary processing files (useful for debugging).

3. If a workspace is not designated, the tool will use the "in_memory" workspace. You will not be able to view the temporary files, _but the processing speed will be much faster_.

tool.summary: This tool moves attributes from one line network to another line network by Segmented Polygon Approach (The segmented polygons are generated using Thiessen Polygons in the Divide Polygons by Segment Tool). Alternatively, tool can use BranchID's from both networks to better manage tributary junctions.
tool.usage:
* Make sure both input datasets are in (the same) **Projected** Coordinate System.

* Make sure From network is segmented (the "To" network may also be segmented) and attributed as desired.
